sourceMeaningMnemonic: When it's <radical>spring</radical> in <radical>heaven</radical> they <kanji>play music</kanji>. To your mortal, human ears it sounds more like snow melting, birds chirping, and plants waking up.
meaningInfo: Close your eyes and imagine all of the spring sounds that come down to you from heaven in the springtime. Mmm, you can almost smell the damp soil and rain.
readingMnemonic: In heaven, the ones that <kanji>play music</kanji> are the <reading>sou</reading>ls (<ja>そう</ja>) of the dead. They have a huge band up there, and even though it just seems like normal spring sounds to you, up there in heaven when the souls play music it's more like a huge, 100-part band!
readingInfo: Picture all of the souls in heaven playing spring music together!
